transactionRate.title: Will you need to pay the higher rate?
transactionRate.description: You'll need to pay the higher rate if you'll own more than one residential property or are buying as a company. Find more information on when you need to pay the higher rate in our higher rates guide.

transactionDate.title: What is the effective date?
transactionDate.description: This is usually the completion date. We use the rates and bands on this date for the calculation.
transactionDate.checkbox: Use today's date for a tax estimate if you do not know the date yet

validation.invalidDate: Enter a valid date. The expected format is DD/MM/YYYY, leading zeros must be used if applicable.
validation.preLtt: This date must not be before 1 April 2018. Land Transaction Tax replaced Stamp Duty Land Tax in Wales from 1 April 2018.

purchasePrice.title: What is the purchase price?
purchasePrice.description: This is the total consideration, rounded down to the nearest pound.
purchasePrice.hint: Enter whole numbers only, do not include decimal points.

validation.aboveMax: The purchase price must not exceed £999,999,999,999

totalPremium.title: What is the total premium?
totalPremium.description: Total premium rounded down to the nearest pound.
totalPremium.hint: Enter whole numbers only, do not include decimal points.

validation.aboveMax: The total premium must not exceed £999,999,999,999

leaseTerm.title: What are the lease start and end dates?
leaseTerm.description: The lease term and rent information are used to calculate the net present value (NPV) of the rent.

startDate.title: What is the lease start date?

endDate.title: What is the lease end date?

validation.startDate: Enter a valid start date of lease. The expected format is DD/MM/YYYY, leading zeros must be used if applicable.
validation.endDate: Enter a valid end date of lease. The expected format is DD/MM/YYYY, leading zeros must be used if applicable.
validation.leaseStartDate: The lease end date must be later than the lease start date.
validation.effectiveDate: The lease end date must be later than the effective date.

calculationDate.title: Which date should be used for the calculation?
calculationDate.description: Examples of where it may be appropriate to select 'Calculate from lease start date' would be in the case of holdover and notional leases, for most other transactions the 'Calculate from the effective date of transaction' would be the appropriate option.
calculationDate.validation: Select a date to be used for calculation.

answers.label: Calculate from the effective date of transaction
